    The class for a King piece in chess
    Author:
    Jared Entin, Antonio Diaz

    • Method Detail

      • executeMove

        public void executeMove​(int targetRow,
                        int targetCol,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces)
        Executes attempted move. Allows for castling.
        Overrides:
        executeMove in class Piece
        Parameters:
        targetRow - Target row
        targetCol - Target column

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(java.lang.String[][] board,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieces,
                           int targetRow,
                           int targetCol,
                           int turn,
                           King k)
        Calls parent class' isValidMove method. Then checks that the king is not in check.
        Overrides:
        isValidMove in class Piece
        Parameters:
        board - The 2-D array with pieces on it
        pieces - An ArrayList of pieces currently on the board
        targetRow - Target row
        targetCol - Target column
        turn - Turn number
        k - The turn player's king piece
        Returns:
        Whether the attempted move is legal or not
